unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Steroid Usage Conditional Probability
question_text:
Many collegiate athletes are tested for performance enhancing steroids.
Suppose a common test gives a positive result for usage of steroids $98\%$ of the time on individuals who actually do use steroids. However, the drug test gives a positive results for steroids when the individual is in fact not using steroids, $8\%$ of the time.
If $15\%$ of college athletes use steroids, what percent of all positive results happen to be from individuals who do NOT use steroids?
